title: Are roles really a must?
body:
{{champion:85}} 
Now, I bet I'll either get a lot of hate for this, or a lot of recognition for my thoughts, and it seems it's not just League of legends that seems to have this issue, in fact most online Massive online games do.

I'll cut to the chase and get straight to the point: 
I understand that Champions are put in specific roles, like support, marksman, tank, mage, assassin, and, fighter
or a combination of some of the above, and people pick roles like mid, adc, carry, tank, jungle, mid, top, ect ect, but is really necessary? why can't players pick a champion they enjoy playing, or a team for argument sakes pick 5 champs that work well, but don't fit into the catagory of the basic team structure that most people go with? I myself would love to be on a team, that played for fun, picked champs they enjoyed, worked together and kicked ass, but it seems that be it LoL, or world of warcraft, or Star wars the old republic, or any other generic MMO, you have your basic 5 (or 4) man team, a tank, a healer, and some dps, be it caster, or melee, but why, why do we have to run by these rules, why can't people be original, and pick, for argument sakes 5 casters, that work, have great crowd control abilities or what ever works for the team and just have fun, why does every game have to be defined by these "so called" unwritten rules? to me personally, the moment you tell people how they SHOULD and SHOULD NOT be playing a game, it stops being a game, it's not fun, instead of insulting a struggling player, why not offer help? or assistance / guidance to help them enjoy the game more? but it's an undying wish that will never be fulfilled, and I have a feeling that I'm going to get a lot of replies saying, "well stop being a noob, or feeder and learn a role" well my response is why should I? if I want to play kennen, I'll play kennen because I like playing kennen, not because he's a mid, or a caster / support, ect ect, just because I enjoy that character, plain and simple.
if you genuinely feel the same, add me on League of Legends, maybe we can create a team that thinks outside of the box, and tries something out of the ordinary, thinks outside of the box, and the mentality that: "well the best strategy is we need one adc, one tank, one carry, a mid, ect ect" I don't care, that isn't original thinking, that's being a sheep that's following a formula, I'm sure even Riot themselves would agree that they would love to see a team that thinks outside of the box, and breaks the formula that people seem to have, and wow people, this for me would be an enjoyable game, one where you aren't told how to play the game, you can just enjoy it. however you see fit.

now that you've read my rant and rave, thoughts and questions please :D

{{champion:20}}

replies.body: I like playing kennen everywhere no matter what dey think, For the love of god I will play him trinity tank top no matter what they say, But im gonna get "reported" I think every player needs to take a good read of the summoners code
Well the Summoner's code doesn't make sense anyway since summoner's don't exist since a year ago when they destroyed our lore.

You can't play a game of soccer where everyone plays on the left wing. The team would lack defenders, attackers, and the goal would be open all game. Everybody has a job to do to bring the team to victory.  It might be fun at the start but eventually the other team will realise that the team comp is shit and will just wander down the right side of the pitch while your team is on the left. 

It might be fun but imho you ultimately require a good team comp so that everyone can do their job.  Thats not to say you can't break meta but if you have a team full of adcs you will usually fail to a team with a good comp.

I don't think there is a rule set in soccer/football that actively discourages or even bans people for playing full left wing comp. Teams just have the common sense not to risk it, especially in professional level.

In LoL, it's actually 1 such case. Because if you play a full left wing team in LoL, you'll either be given a heavy ball, subpar shoes or other random shiet that is only there to intentionally screw you over until you play the game the "right" way.

If there is indeed 1 such rule in that sport, well well, I can see why people are more over video games these days.

That imo is just not right, teams should have their freedom to do what they want as long as it's not harmful.
In normies rift go nuts, in ranked well, a good team comp matters

In competitive play, yeah.

The reason why we have this meta is because it's the most effective and efficient. For example, we have the ADC and Support bottom lane, which usually the ADC is a hypercarry that gets stronger the longer the game goes, and usually they have relatively low base stats and high scalings. Accompanied by the traditional meta support,high base stats, tanky and has a lot of CC, the reason why champions like Alistar, Thresh and Leona are top tier supports because they have good, reliable CC that can peel/engage for their ADC, and that they don't need that much gold to be effective, compared to their ADCs.

Although in norms this really doesn't matter, unless you're super tryhard

I see what you're trying to say but It's all about efficiency, you need a spread of AD and AP otherwise each piece of gold the enemy spends on armour/MR is much more efficient. 
You need all lanes filled and a jungle otherwise you're losing XP and gold. People do play casters top or ADC top/mid but without a solid front line you generally lose the longer games.
That being said if you can structure your coordination right perhaps running double support/jungle could work, So top and bot both have a support who takes smite and farms their side of the jungle...
Most likely won't work though haha.

I really agree here, I hope this gets enough votes to get the attention of a rioter or someone important.

I agree that people should stop trying so hard to follow the meta but I understand that some comps are sub optimal. 

It starts with "winning isn't the goal, having fun is the goal.", abolishing the meta comes afterwards

- Veigar bot + top, Soraka mid + top, Xerath top + bot, Malzahar top, Shen bot player & main

LoL was originally built as a video game, so it originally have many classes of champs but no specific roles since each class can perform at least 2 to 3 roles, just to different extent of efficiency.

Then LoL wanted to become like a sport, so it created the "role" system and introduces meta locking in favour of "constructed matching" which is utter bollocks and nothing else.

The only reason why LoL is so plagued with meta is due to their own low grade balancing. And instead of fixing it (and give us the strategic diverse they have always wanted), they use it as an excuse to make meta completely rigid until Riot changes it for you because they think sub-optimal and situational team comp don't work in video games for whatever reason.

The problem is playing optimally is playing by them set rules.

You don't have to play with the roles, but you will be losing something somewhere.

The formula exists for a reason.

You mention the dungeon style of MMOs like WoW and SW:TOR.
Very simply put you'll find is almost impossible to run a Dungeon/Flashpoint without filling those roles two DPS, one Tank and one Healer.
Especially since those Flashpoints and Dungeons are specifically designed for you to need that group.

Now let's take a look at MOBAs, specifically LoL.
Back in the beta there wasn't any real meta, same for season one.

Watch over season two and three and you see the meta we use today stick in place.
Sure at times the bot lane meta can be annoyingly stagnant (Looking at you Vayne, FUCK OFF) but the overall meta allows room for every champion in LoL's selection to be played.

Often you'll see someone say "FUCK THE META" and go Teemo mid and get destroyed, why does that happen?
Because there are like two champs in mid lane that Teemo counters and everyone else ruins Teemo's day.

I love playing Urgot, he's fun, so I take him top, the majority of the time I win my lane with him, same as when I take Thresh and Taric top. Their abilities and play style fit top lane, sure a lot of people will rage at you saying "Thresh is a support you faggot!" and often I've had a major cunt decide that because I'm playing Thresh top they will feed my lane because they hate me for doing it.
Overall Thresh fits the "top lane meta".

The meta isn't rigid and solid like people claim and believe it to be, it's more fluid and ever moving.
That being said, don't just say "FUCK THE META" instant lock Zilean jungle despite someone else having called jungle before you.
Take time to think out what actually will work before trying it, respect pick order/call order in champion select, and don't be an utter cunt bag in game.
I don't instalock, to be an arse, but I generally ask, if they want me as kennen and nunu, I'm open to different champs, but I've never played an adc, or jungle before
